cs236.lab1
Class Tokenizer

java.lang.Object
  cs236.lab1.Tokenizer

public class Tokenizer
extends java.lang.Object

Tokenizer parses a text file into individual Tokens as defined by the Datalog spec.

Constructor Summary

          Only do this when you want to optimize for memory allocation.
Tokenizer(java.lang.String sFile)
          Convenience method for the empty constructor and setFile().

 void cleanUp()
          Closes the stream associated with the file being read.

          Gets the next token.
 void setFile(java.lang.String sFile)
          Creates a new InputStream and sets the lineNumber to 0.

Constructor Detail

Tokenizer

public Tokenizer()
Only do this when you want to optimize for memory allocation. Call setFile() to start parsing.

          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException

Method Detail

setFile

public final void setFile(java.lang.String sFile)
                   throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Creates a new InputStream and sets the lineNumber to 0. This can be used with cleanUp to save memory allocation when working with multiple files.

Parameters:
sFile -
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - The file given is not valid

cleanUp

public void cleanUp()
Closes the stream associated with the file being read.

getNextToken

public Token getNextToken()
Gets the next token. This reads from the stream created in the Constructor.

Returns:
the next Token in the file
